page.title: 02BELAS KNAP - Pt.1
page.content: This Neolithic chambered tomb,possibly dating from 3000 BC, is the earliest evidence of human settlement in the{ {Winchcombe}area. (1) The route to Belas Knap passes along narrow, steep Corndean Lane, itself 500 years old. Turning right up a footpath Belas Knap stands 950 feet above sea-level, on the brow of the escarpment above Humblebee How plant- ation. Belas Knap Barrow is 170ft.long,60ft wide and 12ft.high. At the front of the mound is a false portal,consisting of a stone lintel resting on two uprights. Inside the long barrow, archaeologists found the remains of a twenty year old man and five children. To the side of Belas Knap are four chambers, which may have been covered seperately before being further covered by the main barrow. (2)
